metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4189 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in Python, specifically in the FTP (File TransferProtocol) client library in PASV (passive) mode. The issue is how the FTPclient trusts the host from the PASV response by default. This flaw allowsan attacker to set up a malicious FTP server that can trick FTP clientsinto connecting back to a given IP address and port. This vulnerabilitycould lead to FTP client scanning ports, which otherwise would not havebeen possible.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4189` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.7
libpython2.7 - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.7
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.7
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.7
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.7
python2.7 - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.7
python2.7-examples - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.7
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.7
No subscription required

idle-python3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.7
libpython3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.7
libpython3.6-minimal - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.7
libpython3.6-stdlib - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.7
libpython3.6-testsuite - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.7
python3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.7
python3.6-examples - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.7
python3.6-minimal - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.7
python3.6-venv - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.7').
python3.6 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.7').
python3.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
python3.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
